content:
• Tuesday, November 6, 2012
  • BTH

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) lowers its FY12 EPS guidance to $2.28 - $2.43 from $2.47 - $2.62, citing...

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) lowers its FY12 EPS guidance to $2.28 - $2.43 from $2.47 - $2.62, citing seasonality, a difficult global macroeconomic environment and weak overall demand for its discretionary consumer products. Shares -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 PM
  • PKT

    Procera (NYSEMKT:PKT) now +11.9% AH following its Q3 beat. The Street has to be pleased with a...

    Procera (NYSEMKT:PKT) now +11.9% AH following its Q3 beat. The Street has to be pleased with a 900 bps Q/Q and 1100 bps Y/Y increase in gross margin to 72%. Also, the company mentioned it won deals with 3 new "Tier 1" carriers, and that mobile networks accounted for 45% of sales. Procera's deep packet inspection hardware helps carriers cope with soaring mobile data usage by allowing them to analyze and prioritize traffic. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI) says that its director, president and CEO, Bassam Damaj, Ph.D., has...

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI) says that its director, president and CEO, Bassam Damaj, Ph.D., has resigned effective immediately, and that Steve Martin, senior vice president and CFO, has been appointed interim CEO. The company also announced that its board has retained an executive recruiting firm to assist in identifying a permanent CEO with pharmaceutical industry experience. Shares -2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) suffers from a double whammy after the close,...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) suffers from a double whammy after the close, simultaneously missing on its Q3 results and disclosing that E.U. regulators aren't going to approve Adasuve due to major objections. In September, the company received the Day 180 List of Outstanding Issues from European regulators which questions whether the data supports the drug's broad indication as submitted, and if the dosage requirements to achieve any benefit warrant the risk. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -9.9%) closed with losses as investors digested the Google verdict. Equity Brief...

    Vringo (VRNG -9.9%) closed with losses as investors digested the Google verdict. Equity Brief reports "sources in the Virginia courtroom" (no details on which faction, if any, they support) believe the jury's recommended 3.5% royalty rate would translate into payments of $125M/year until 2016 if upheld. (earlier: I, II, III).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 8 Comments
  • GPOR

    More on Gulfport Energy's (NASDAQ:GPOR) Q3 results: Estimates 2013 production of 6.5M-6.8M boe,...

    More on Gulfport Energy's (NASDAQ:GPOR) Q3 results: Estimates 2013 production of 6.5M-6.8M boe, capex $283M-$299M. Plans to drill 22-24 wells at WCBB, 10-12 wells at Hackberry, ~50 in the Utica Shale. Plans to participate in Grizzly's winter exploration program and fund its remaining commitment related to the construction of Grizzly's Algar Lake project. GPOR +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) says the FDA has approved Xeljanz for the treatment of adults with moderately...

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) says the FDA has approved Xeljanz for the treatment of adults with moderately to severely active rheumatoid arthritis, who have had an inadequate response or intolerance to methotrexate. The drug may be used as a single therapy treatment, or in combination with methotrexate or other non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs. Shares +1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • LXRX

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) finished -4% today, despite its earlier...

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) finished -4% today, despite its earlier announcement that that favorable data from Phase 2b clinical trials of its diabetes drug LX4211 was being presented today at the American Heart Association Scientific Sessions Conference in Los Angeles. According to the company, results demonstrate potential benefits in improving glycemic control, as well as reductions in cardiovascular risk factors such as blood pressure and body weight.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • PLXS

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS) -22.2% AH after announcing its contract manufacturing relationship with...

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS) -22.2% AH after announcing its contract manufacturing relationship with Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) is coming to an end at some point during its current fiscal year (ends Sep. '13). The company notes it has been "an important strategic supplier" to Juniper for over a decade, and will discuss the news on a CC at 8AM ET tomorrow (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics International (NASDAQ:SGI): FQ1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $193M...

    Silicon Graphics International (NASDAQ:SGI): FQ1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $193M (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +15.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • ARNA

    More on Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA): Q3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on...

    More on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA): Q3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue. Separately, the company announced that it had granted Ildong Pharmaceutical exclusive rights to market and distribute its weight-loss drug Belviq in South Korea, subject to regulatory approval of BELVIQ by the Korea Food and Drug Administration. Shares +1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 8 Comments
  • LPSN

    LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN): Q3 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $39.7M (+15.7% Y/Y) misses by...

    LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN): Q3 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $39.7M (+15.7% Y/Y) misses by $1.3M. Shares -11.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • PKT

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT): Q3 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $16.1M (+32.1% Y/Y)...

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT): Q3 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $16.1M (+32.1% Y/Y) beats by $0.3M. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • EZPW

    EZCorp (NASDAQ:EZPW): Q3 EPS of $0.75 in-line. Revenue of $258.4M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by $2M....

    EZCorp (NASDAQ:EZPW): Q3 EPS of $0.75 in-line. Revenue of $258.4M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • STEC

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q3 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $42.1M (-41.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q3 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $42.1M (-41.9% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • LLNW

    Limelight (LLNW -3.9%) sold off today after disclosing its Q1 cash flow figures need to be...

    Limelight (LLNW -3.9%) sold off today after disclosing its Q1 cash flow figures need to be corrected. Q1 operating cash flow will go to -$1.8M from +$4M, and net cash used in investing activities will go to -$8M from -$13.8M. The company announced a CEO change last week to go with its Q3 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • TDW

    In its FQ2 conference call, Tidewater (TDW -6%) warns about items that will unfavorably impact...

    In its FQ2 conference call, Tidewater (TDW -6%) warns about items that will unfavorably impact FQ3 (Dec.), including a contract review by Petrobras resulting in delays from vessels going on charter, and increased vessels in dry-dock resulting in lower vessel revenue and higher maintenance costs. TDW guides FQ3 vessel operating margins to 34%-38% vs. 43% in FQ2 (results).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -8%) gets hit after its Q3 report falls wide of the mark. Revenue...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -8%) gets hit after its Q3 report falls wide of the mark. Revenue plummeted 43% Y/Y due to the volatility of its income stream, which largely consists of licensing fees, milestone payments and other similar billing arrangements.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO +3.2%) adds to earlier gains from its Q3 results as CEO Clarence Cazalot tells...

    Marathon Oil (MRO +3.2%) adds to earlier gains from its Q3 results as CEO Clarence Cazalot tells a conference call the company "is positioned to meet or exceed our full-year production targets." MRO raises in FY13 target for Eagle Ford production to ~85K net boe/day from 70K prior, and Bakken production to ~33K net boe/day from 30K; its Eagle Ford Burrow well could be a "monster."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • XL

    Property-and-casualty insurer XL Group (XL +1.7%) moves up after its Q3 earnings beat across the...

    Property-and-casualty insurer XL Group (XL +1.7%) moves up after its Q3 earnings beat across the board late yesterday. Net profit soared underwriting results improved and core profits strengthened. The company's combined ratio - the percentage of premiums paid out on losses and expenses - improved to 92.2% from 101.6% in the P&C business, due largely a lower number of large losses and fewer catastrophes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -1%) has resumed trading following its legal win (I, II) against Google, which...

    Vringo (VRNG -1%) has resumed trading following its legal win (I, II) against Google, which featured a smaller damage award than some were hoping for. Shares are volatile once again, spiking above and below breakeven. In a PR detailing the verdict, Vringo notes prior art arguments were rejected, and that a "running royalty" of 3.5% on Google AdWords revenue (subject to a judge's review) has been recommended.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 8 Comments
  • MLNX

    EZchip (EZCH -2.8%) is underperforming after Captsone starts coverage with a Hold and $35 PT....

    EZchip (EZCH -2.8%) is underperforming after Captsone starts coverage with a Hold and $35 PT. The network processor vendor, which (like its peers) is contending with a difficult service provider capex environment, posts Q3 results on Thursday morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • NLY

    "The active involvement of policymakers in the mortgage market . has introduced unique...

    "The active involvement of policymakers in the mortgage market ... has introduced unique challenges for all investors," says Annaly (NLY -3.7%) CEO Wellington Denehan-Norris on the earnings call (transcript), not hiding her frustration with all the meddling. Credit Suisse cuts its price target on NLY to $16 from $17. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • OCLR

    Though many optical component names are following Fabrinet higher, Oclaro (OCLR -13.7%) is...

    Though many optical component names are following Fabrinet higher, Oclaro (OCLR -13.7%) is selling off after reporting FQ1 revenue of $148.8M (+43% Y/Y, boosted by Opnext acquisition) and EPS of -$0.39 - the latter missed by $0.10. An 800 bps Q/Q drop in gross margin to 13% didn't help. FQ1 guidance is for revenue of $145M-$162M (below a $170M consensus) and gross margin of 12%-18%. Oclaro noted on its earnings call European and Asian demand is weak, and that  results were affected by execution and Opnext integration challenges.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • ROCM

    Rochester Medical (ROCM -1%) says it's decided to cease manufacturing and marketing its line of...

    Rochester Medical (ROCM -1%) says it's decided to cease manufacturing and marketing its line of Foley Catheters, saying it plans to focus on its core product lines of Intermittent Catheters and Male External Catheters. The company will continue to fulfill orders for up to 90 days, during which time it expects to deplete the majority of its inventory. The company estimates the decision will significantly enhance its profitability, adding an estimated $3M-$4M to its pre-tax profit line annually.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +4.3%) shares hit four-year highs before pulling back, as CEO Mark...

    EOG Resources (EOG +4.3%) shares hit four-year highs before pulling back, as CEO Mark Papa tells a conference call after Q3 results beat expectations that EOG plans to spend less on "money-losing" drilling next year, which will result in lower capital expenditures. EOG expects to spend ~$7.6B this year, but next year's budget will shrink as it spends less on drilling.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • AWI

    Flooring and building-products maker Armstrong World Industries (AWI -2.2%) slips after...

    Flooring and building-products maker Armstrong World Industries (AWI -2.2%) slips after announcing a secondary offering earlier, saying that certain shareholders are putting up 5.2M shares for sale. The company has a current float of around 58.8M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • AKS

    Steel companies are advancing after AK Steel (AKS +6.5%) announced last night that it would...

    Steel companies are advancing after AK Steel (AKS +6.5%) announced last night that it would increase prices for all carbon steel products by $50/ton. Also, Nucor (NUE +1.7%) enjoys a boost as its deal for a 50% working interest in gas wells to be drilled by Encana hedges against an expected future rise in U.S. natural gas prices. X +5.8%, SCHN +5.4%, STLD +4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • FN

    Fabrinet (FN +31.2%) is having a memorable day after reporting FQ1 revenue of $158.6M (-15% Y/Y)...

    Fabrinet (FN +31.2%) is having a memorable day after reporting FQ1 revenue of $158.6M (-15% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.36, soundly beating a consensus of $147M and $0.31. FQ2 guidance is for revenue of $159M-$163M and EPS of $0.35-$0.37, above a consensus of $154M and $0.33. The news is lifting some optical component names, due to Fabrinet's status as a top contract manufacturer for the industry. JDSU +2.5%. FNSR +3.2%. NPTN +4.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG) has won its patent suit against Google (NASDAQ:GOOG). The company has been awarded...

    Vringo (VRNG) has won its patent suit against Google (NASDAQ:GOOG). The company has been awarded $30M in damages and a royalty on Google search ad revenue through 2016, when Vringo's patent expires - some reports indicate the royalty rate is 3.5%. Google will almost certainly appeal. Vringo shares remain halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 29 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers International (WTW +14.15%) racks up a solid gain today after its Q3 handily...

    Weight Watchers International (WTW +14.15%) racks up a solid gain today after its Q3 handily beat Street estimates. Net profit slid 16% Y/Y however, on flat revenue as the weight-management services provider recorded higher expenses. The company also lowered the top end of its earnings outlook by $0.10 due to some accelerated investments and the impact of Hurrican Sandy. It now projects to earn between $4.00 to $4.10 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • WDAY

    Workday (WDAY -1.9%) is lower on underwriter coverage day, as 5 bullish ratings are joined by 3...

    Workday (WDAY -1.9%) is lower on underwriter coverage day, as 5 bullish ratings are joined by 3 neutral ones. Like UBS, the cautious parties criticize Workday's valuation while praising its potential. JPMorgan: "While we believe WDAY may become one of the most important software names of this generation by fundamentally changing how enterprises manage their HR and financial records, the company’s cash flow profile suggests the stock is fairly valued at current levels." (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA -4.1%) is lower in response to Zillow's (Z -19.1%) soft Q4 guidance. During its...

    Trulia (TRLA -4.1%) is lower in response to Zillow's (Z -19.1%) soft Q4 guidance. During its earnings call, Zillow attributed its slowing display ad growth to its decision to "shift more territory" on its site to its core Marketplace business. However, the company also noted it's not generating much right now from mobile display ads (partly to keep the focus on Marketplace content), and that ad sales stemming from a partnership with Foreclosure.com have disappeared due to Zillow's launch of its own foreclosure search product. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • SYKE

    Call-center operator Sykes Enterprises (SYKE +12.38%) gets a boost after its Q3 fared better...

    Call-center operator Sykes Enterprises (SYKE +12.38%) gets a boost after its Q3 fared better than Wall Street expected, helped by stronger demand in its financial services and communications business. The company also guided its Q4 higher, now expecting to earn between $0.28 to $0.33 per share on revenue in the range of $300M to $305M, above the Street view of $0.31 on $272M in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • FANG

    Diamondback Energy (FANG +3.2%) benefits from a raft of new favorable analyst coverage. Wells...

    Diamondback Energy (FANG +3.2%) benefits from a raft of new favorable analyst coverage. Wells Fargo, for one, believes it brings an impressive growth profile, driven by low-risk Wolfberry drilling along with upside potential in the Wolfcamp and potentially other formations, as horizontal drilling takes hold in the Permian basin. Other new coverage: I, II, III, IV.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM

  • Speculating Bernanke has taken the lead in exit polls, ZH notes gold has gone vertical in the...

    Speculating Bernanke has taken the lead in exit polls, ZH notes gold has gone vertical in the past few minutes (chart). GLD +2%. SLV +3.1%. Oil is on the move as well, USO +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 29 Comments
  • MU

    Micron (MU +3.2%) is rallying after Taiwanese DRAM vendors Nanya and Inotera report M/M...

    Micron (MU +3.2%) is rallying after Taiwanese DRAM vendors Nanya and Inotera report M/M increases of 20.4% and 5.7%, respectively, for their October revenue. On a Y/Y basis, both companies, who have been bleeding cash, saw their sales decline. Meanwhile, Powerchip continues to shift manufacturing capacity away from PC DRAM, something that could improve the depressed market's supply/demand balance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM +5.07%) moves up after its Q3 beat on a per share basis, despite...

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM +5.07%) moves up after its Q3 beat on a per share basis, despite declining margins. Gross margin fell to 20.8% from 22.3%, but net profit rose 28% Y/Y on a stronger-than-expected 24% jump in sales in the company's aggregates business, by far its largest top-line contributor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.1%) gets a respite from its post-earnings selloff after Capstone starts...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.1%) gets a respite from its post-earnings selloff after Capstone starts coverage with a Buy and $40 PT. Shares are currently trading at just 8.4x estimated FY14 (ends in March) EPS - rightly or wrongly, the Street is clearly worried those estimates won't hold due to margin pressure and/or future declines in Apple share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • NUE

    Nucor (NUE +2%) enters a long-term agreement with Encana (ECA +0.7%) to create an onshore...

    Nucor (NUE +2%) enters a long-term agreement with Encana (ECA +0.7%) to create an onshore natural gas drilling program that it says will provide a reliable, low-cost supply of the fuel for more than 20 years for its steel mills and other U.S. facilities, particularly the direct reduced iron facility it is building in Louisiana where iron ore is processed into a concentrate.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • CMG

    Chipotle (CMG +5.6%) moves higher after catching an upgrade from Bank of America to Buy from...

    Chipotle (CMG +5.6%) moves higher after catching an upgrade from Bank of America to Buy from Hold. The firm notes CMG trades at a 30% discount to its 5-year average valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -12.9%) takes a big hit after missing Q3 EPS estimates earlier this...

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -12.9%) takes a big hit after missing Q3 EPS estimates earlier this morning as total revenue cratered over 31% Y/Y. Net losses were also wider-than-anticipated as production fell short of expectations. The oil-and-gas explorer also lowered its production forecast for the current quarter, now expecting it to be around 330-340 MMcfe per day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • FSLR

    U.S. solar plays First Solar (FSLR +7.1%) and SunPower (SPWR +6.2%) are having a good day....

    U.S. solar plays First Solar (FSLR +7.1%) and SunPower (SPWR +6.2%) are having a good day. Growing expectations among observers that Pres. Obama will be re-elected could be fueling the gains, in light of his administration's support for DOE solar funding in the face of Congressional opposition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • MKTG

    Responsys (MKTG -30.4%) has plunged to new post-IPO lows following its Q3 report. The company's...

    Responsys (MKTG -30.4%) has plunged to new post-IPO lows following its Q3 report. The company's guidance for Q4 revenue of $42M-$43M and EPS of $0.05 (below a consensus of $45M and $0.07) is the main culprit. Fellow cloud marketing software firm ExactTarget (ET-OLD -5.9%) is lower in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • FTR

    Though Frontier's (FTR -4%) top and bottom-line numbers met estimates, the rural telco is...

    Though Frontier's (FTR -4%) top and bottom-line numbers met estimates, the rural telco is selling off. The loss of another 51.8K customers could be a factor, though that number is a little better than Q2's 65.7K. Local/long distance revenue fell 8% Y/Y as Frontier's local loop base continues to wither, while data revenue was up slightly. Free cash flow fell 24% Q/Q to $215.3M, though Frontier's 2012 FCF guidance is unchanged at $900M-$1B. 2013 capex guidance has been set at $625M-$675M, down from 2012's $750M-$775M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS -21.2%) tank following a disappointing Q3 report earlier today. Despite...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS -21.2%) tank following a disappointing Q3 report earlier today. Despite better revenue, bottom line results missed estimates due to higher Qsymia-related expenses. Additionally, the company says in its conference call that the lack of insurer coverage is a "big concern," and hurting sales of the weight-loss drug. Just 1 in 5 patients get reimbursement, and many patients skip filling prescriptions rather than pay the $160 monthly price tag. (Conference Call Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -10.8%) tumbles after announcing: 1) CEO Brett Hurt, who has held the top...

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -10.8%) tumbles after announcing: 1) CEO Brett Hurt, who has held the top job since '05, will be replaced by CFO Stephen Collins. Hurt will remains as vice-chairman. 2) It's acquiring Longboard Media, a provider of online ad management solutions for retailers, for $32M-$43M in cash and stock, depending on incentives. Longboard complements BV's existing media solutions. 3) Guiding for FY13 (ends in April) revenue of $156M-$158M, above a $155.7M consensus. (PowerReviews deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • HL

    Silver miners (SIL -0.6%) are struggling with low prices, as evidenced by Q3 results from Hecla...

    Silver miners (SIL -0.6%) are struggling with low prices, as evidenced by Q3 results from Hecla Mining (HL -4.8%) and Coeur d'Alene (CDE -18.8%), where prices were down 23% and 5.5% Y/Y respectively; a 14% drop was blamed for falling revenues and profits at Silver Wheaton (SLW -0.5%). Pan American Silver (PAAS -2.3%) is scheduled to report Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • MED

    Medifast (MED +7.4%) trades up this morning after a solid Q3 report yesterday, and earlier set a...

    Medifast (MED +7.4%) trades up this morning after a solid Q3 report yesterday, and earlier set a 52-week high of $29.20 before tapering off. The company guided Q4 above Street consensus, now seeing EPS at $0.23 to $0.25 on revenue of $82M to $84M, beating expectations for $0.19 per share on $79M in revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK +6.9%) rallies all the way to $0.93 after announcing it will receive $33.4M to...

    LDK Solar (LDK +6.9%) rallies all the way to $0.93 after announcing it will receive $33.4M to terminate a solar wafer supply agreement with Japan's Sumitomo. Much like rival MEMC's (WFR +1.9%) terminations, LDK's deal with Sumitomo unraveled because the huge price declines seen for solar wafers made the terms of the original deal uneconomical.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • HAS

    Hasbro (HAS +1.9%) trims early gains built up off a rumor Disney wants to buy the company....

    Hasbro (HAS +1.9%) trims early gains built up off a rumor Disney wants to buy the company. CNBC's David Faber tweets that the prospect of a deal is news to Hasbro's bankers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • AMRI

    Albany Molecular Research (AMRI +11%) pops after beating on its Q3 bottom line this morning....

    Albany Molecular Research (AMRI +11%) pops after beating on its Q3 bottom line this morning. Total sales were up 11.2% Y/Y on stronger royalty and contract revenues, particularly in its large-scale manufacturing segment. The company also boosts its outlook for FY12 as well as Q4. It now sees FY12 earnings coming in between $0.10 and $0.16 per share, towards the top-end of the Street's $0.12 consensus, and for Q4, its EPS is targeted to be $0.08 to $0.12, also better than the Street view of $0.06.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI -39.1%) is getting walloped following its FQ2 report. Though results beat (very low)...

    THQ (THQI -39.1%) is getting walloped following its FQ2 report. Though results beat (very low) estimates, the company suspended its FY13 guidance, delayed the release of South Park: The Stick of Truth to early FY14 from March '13, and stated it will need fresh capital to finance game development. THQ, which has $100M in convertible notes due Aug. '14, says it has engaged an advisory firm to help evaluate alternatives. With its market cap now standing at just $12.7M, it's safe to assume many doubt THQ's ability to avoid bankruptcy. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • DNR

    A negative reversal in its derivatives fortunes sent Q3 net profit crashing 70% at Denbury...

    A negative reversal in its derivatives fortunes sent Q3 net profit crashing 70% at Denbury Resources (DNR -1.8%), but full-year production looks to be on track to hit the higher end of previous forecasts thanks to a ramp-up in Bakken numbers. Average production grew 9% Y/Y to 72,776 boe/day, but sales prices, excluding hedging impacts, fell 4% for oil and 38% for natural gas.
